author: Bloomberg.com
title: China Securities Said to Seek at Least $80 Billion for Stocks
text:
China Securities Finance Corp. is seeking at least 500 billion yuan ($80.5 billion) in liquidity to support the stock market, according to people familiar with the matter.
China Securities Finance is seeking liquidity from the People’s Bank of China and may also tap the interbank market, according to the people, who asked not to be identified because the move hasn’t been made public. The final amount is yet to be determined and may be far more than 500 billion yuan, according to the people.
The People’s Bank of China said in a statement this morning that it will provide ample liquidity to the company via channels of loans and bonds. It didn’t respond to a faxed request for comment on whether China Securities was seeking funds.
China’s benchmark stock index has lost more than 30 percent in less than a month. At least 1,249 companies have halted trading on mainland Chinese exchanges, accounting for 43 percent of total listings. The suspensions have locked up a minimum $2.2 trillion of shares, or 33 percent of China’s market capitalization, according to data compiled by Bloomberg.
